snippet: Whether one bear needs three memorials in a single city is debatable. But in Germany, Knut became a national obsession, and apparently still is.
abstract: Berlin Journal; Berlin is planning to unveil at least three monuments to honor Knut the Polar Bear, much-loved animal in the Berlin Zoo who became a national obsession before his sudden death in March 2011; plans reflect both the city's preoccupation with memorials and the country's fascination with animals.
lead_paragraph: Whether one bear needs three memorials in a single city is debatable. But in Germany, Knut became a national obsession, and apparently still is.

headline.seo: Berlin Journal: In Death as in Life, Knut the Polar Bear Draws Attention
